result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikki Lynn Greiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Absolute sobriety.

No drugs without a prescription. No drug paraphernalia. 

No alcohol. 

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must successfully complete Polk County Treatment Court program. 

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nikki Lynn Greiner

records.addlTxt:
2:19 PM Defendant Nikki Lynn Greiner in court, in custody.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Nikki Lynn Greiner. Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Burger recites agreement. ADA states he will file an amended information. Copy provided to court. CT questions def. Felony warnings given. On count 3 fel bail jump- def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. Counts 1,2 and 4 are RI&D on state's motion. CT finds def's waiver of PSI is made FK&V. Counsel stipulates to 19 days credit. Atty Burger- argument. 

SENTENCE: W/held sent 1 year probation. Must successfully complete PC treatment court. AS. No drugs without a prescription. No alcohol. No drug para.  $290.60 fine/costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC.  PCR. 2:33 pm adj. *May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship right.
Final pre-trial on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 11, 2023 at 08:30 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Nikki Lynn Greiner not in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Nikki Lynn Greiner.  Attorney Holly Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Burger- def is in Barron County jail. Not resolved at this point. Requesting a trial be set. Requesting trial and FPT be set with JA, analyst will be needed. CT authorizes warrant but stays it until next hearing date. Counsel to contact JA to schedule. All motions to be filed 30 days prior to FPT.  Dispositive Motions due 60 days prior to FPT and to be scheduled with Judicial Assistant. Scheduling Order will be sent out by JA. 10:31 am adj.

Not to have contact with: co-defendant Danielle Steffen.  No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to possess or use any one else's personal documents.

22CF138 BBH & PHA. Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nikki L Greiner in court, in custody.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Nikki L Greiner. 3:15 p.m. AO-Clerk. 

Preliminary Hearing & Arraignment - Atty Burger - de waives PH. Ct accepts waiver, de bound over. State efiles Information.  Victims rights complied with.  Atty Burger preserved on all prearraignment rights for 15 days. Atty Burger - waive reading, plea NG on each count. 

Bond Hearing - Atty Burger requests bond be modified to signature. State does not object. Ct modifies bond. 

Bond cont. 3:21 p.m. adj.
Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on April 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Attorney Donna Burger appears in court. 1:03 p.m. AO-Clerk. De has rec'd CC, de qualifies, waive reading. State requests $1000 cash bond. Ct sets bond. DSPH. 1:12 p.m. adj.
